Autoimmune pancreatitis AIP is now considered a pancreatic manifestation of a newly proposed disease condition IgG4-related disease IgG4-RD

Sentences1.text: Recent epidemiological studies have addressed the incidence of cancer in patients with AIP and/or IgG4-RD

Sentences2.text: Surprisingly a significant number of AIP patients were detected with cancer at or within one year of the diagnosis of AIP

Sentences3.text: Furthermore around 50 of all cancers detected in AIP patients comprised mainly 3 types gastric lung and prostate cancer

Sentences4.text: Thus AIP appears to be associated with cancer of other organs rather than the pancreas itself which suggests that AIP is not a pre-cancerous condition of the pancreas

Sentences5.text: Moreover the simultaneous occurrence of cancer and AIP in many patients has led to the establishment of an attractive concept that AIP might sometimes arise from co-existing cancers as a paraneoplastic syndrome

Sentences6.text: Introduction Autoimmune pancreatitis AIP is a unique form of chronic pancreatitis in which autoimmunity against as-yet-unidentified auto antigens Ags underlie the chronic fibro-inflammatory responses in the pancreas 1

Sentences7.text: AIP is now classified into type 1 AIP and type 2 AIP based on clinical features pathological findings and IgG4 antibody Ab responses 2

Sentences8.text: It is generally accepted that type 1 AIP also called lymphoplasmacytic sclerosing pancreatitis is a pancreatic manifestation of the systemic IgG4-related disease IgG4-RD

Sentences9.text: Massive infiltration of IgG4-expressing plasmacytes into the affected organs accompanied by storiform fibrosis is a prominent pathological feature of type 1 AIP 3-5

Sentences10.text: A wide variety of single-organ diseases such as AIP sialoadenitis and retroperitoneal fibrosis are now regarded as organ-specific manifestations of this systemic autoimmune disorder 3-5

Sentences11.text: As the number of patients with IgG4-RD and type 1 AIP increases gastroenterologists and clinical immunologists promote further their investigations of type 1 AIP and our knowledge regarding the clinicopathological findings is rapidly expanding

Sentences12.text: At present however our knowledge of the clinicopathological findings of type 2 AIP also called idiopathic duct centric chronic pancreatitis is limited

Sentences13.text: Infiltration of neutrophils but not IgG4-expressing plasmacytes is a pathological hallmark of type 2 AIP 5 6

Sentences14.text: In addition the co-occurrence of inflammatory bowel diseases is sometimes seen in patients with type 2 AIP

Sentences15.text: These differences in clinicopathological features between type 1 and type 2 AIP support the idea that two different types of immune responses are involved in the development of AIP although both diseases are sensitive to corticosteroid treatment

Sentences16.text: Given that AIP is a unique form of chronic fibroinflammatory disorder of the pancreas it is possible that AIP is a pre-cancerous condition

Sentences17.text: Indeed recent studies have addressed the relationship between AIP and malignant diseases 10-14

Sentences18.text: Interestingly it has been suggested that the presence of AIP is associated with cancers of other organs rather than the pancreas

Sentences19.text: In this review we discuss the risk of cancer in type 1 AIP and IgG4-RD

Sentences20.text: Incidence of Cancer in IgG4-RD and AIP Shiokawa et al

Sentences21.text: were the first to show that the incidence of cancer after the diagnosis of AIP is significantly higher in patients with AIP than in a sex- age- and observation period-matched standard population in a multicenter retrospective cohort study 10  Table 1

Sentences22.text: They investigated the incidence of cancer at or after the diagnosis of AIP in 108 patients

Sentences23.text: During the follow-up period 15 AIP patients 13 9  were diagnosed with cancer

Sentences24.text: Thus these data support the idea that the presence of AIP is a strong risk factor for cancer

Sentences25.text: Their study included 109 patients with AIP and 28 patients with AIP developed cancer at or after the diagnosis of AIP Table 3

Sentences26.text: Furthermore a high incidence of cancer in AIP patients with a high level of SIR 17 3 was also reported in a single-center study in Germany 15  Table 1

Sentences27.text: They investigated 106 patients with IgG4-RD including 10 patients with type 1 AIP and performed a retrospective observational study to determine the occurrence rate of cancer following the diagnosis of IgG4-RD

Sentences28.text: In addition 2 of the 10 AIP patients were diagnosed with renal cell cancer and prostate cancer during the follow-up period Table 3

Sentences29.text: In addition to the these reports providing evidence that the presence of AIP and/or IgG4-RD increase the risk of cancer after the diagnosis one report showed an association between IgG4-RD and a history of malignancy 16  Table 2 3

Sentences30.text: Therefore it may be possible that not only does the presence of IgG4-RD and/or AIP increase the risk of cancer but also that the pre-existing malignant disorders are associated with the subsequent development of IgG4-RD and/or AIP 16

Sentences31.text: In contrast to the aforementioned studies two recent studies failed to confirm the association between AIP and cancer Table 1

Sentences44.text: Is Type 1 AIP a Pre-cancerous Condition

Sentences45.text: If AIP enhances the risk of cancer then the next question is whether proceeding AIP promotes the development of malignancy through inflammation-associated carcinogenesis

Sentences46.text: Several case reports regarding the co-existence of AIP and pancreatic cancer are available 18 19

Sentences47.text: One single-center study showed that the incident rate of pancreatic cancer after the diagnosis of AIP or CP was comparable between the two groups 4 8 vs 2 4  20

Sentences48.text: Given that CP is one of the strongest risk factors for the development of pancreatic cancer 21  surveillance for the development of pancreatic cancer might also be required for patients with AIP

Sentences49.text: However in contrast to these previous findings the incidence of pancreatic cancer at or after the diagnosis of AIP is not very high ranging from 0 0 to 17 among all of the detected cancers Table 1 2

Sentences50.text: It therefore seems less likely that AIP increases the risk of pancreatic cancer through inflammation-associated carcinogenesis

Sentences51.text: To clarify the relationship between AIP and pancreatic cancer we investigated the types of cancer in patients with AIP at or after the diagnosis of AIP in five reports 10 11 13-15  in which types of cancers at or after the diagnosis of AIP were fully described

Sentences52.text: As shown in Figure gastric lung and prostate cancer are frequently detected cancers in patients with AIP and account for around 50 of all cancers detected at or after the diagnosis of AIP

Sentences53.text: These data regarding cancer distribution strongly suggest that the presence of AIP might be more closely associated with extra-pancreatic gastric lung and prostate cancers rather than pancreatic cancer

Sentences54.text: Thus it is unlikely that the presence of AIP promotes the development of pancreatic cancer through inflammation-associated carcinogenesis

Sentences69.text: Thus the limitations of the recent epidemiological studies are the lack of analyses of cancer risk factors in both AIP/IgG4-RD patients and control subjects

Sentences71.text: Is Type 1 AIP a Paraneoplastic Syndrome

Sentences72.text: Two Japanese studies reported that a significant population of patients with type 1 AIP already had cancer at the time of the AIP diagnosis 10 11

Sentences73.text: We must therefore consider the possibility of co-existing cancer upon the diagnosis of AIP

Sentences74.text: According to the studies by Shiokawa et al  10 cancer cases were diagnosed at or within 1 year of the AIP diagnosis 10

Sentences75.text: Strikingly eight cancer cases were detected at the diagnosis of AIP

Sentences76.text: A high incidence of cancer early after the diagnosis of AIP was also reported in Asano s study 14

Sentences77.text: proposed that pre-existing cancer might evoke IgG4-related type 1 AIP and that type 1 AIP can occur as an autoimmune paraneoplastic disease

Sentences78.text: They therefore speculate that as-yet-undisclosed immune responses caused by the malignant tumors might underlie the immuno-pathogenesis of simultaneous occurrence of type 1 AIP and cancer

Sentences79.text: A high incidence of cancer in AIP patients early after the diagnosis can be fully explained by this novel concept

Sentences80.text: As in the case of other autoimmune paraneoplastic disorders such as polymyositis and dermatomyositis 27 28  remission of AIP has been achieved after the successful treatment of co-existing cancer 10

Sentences81.text: propose a very attractive concept that type 1 AIP and IgG4-RD can occur as a paraneoplastic syndrome

Sentences82.text: Confirmation of this new concept awaits future prospective studies that address the time window of cancer occurrence in a large number of patients with AIP and IgG4-RD

Sentences83.text: In addition elucidation of the molecular mechanisms underlying how co-existing cancer induces AIP and/or IgG4-RD as a paraneoplastic syndrome will help strengthen this concept

Sentences84.text: Conclusion The presence of AIP may be associated with the risk of cancers of extra-pancreatic organs such as the stomach lung and prostate

Sentences85.text: However the presence of AIP and/or IgG4-RD may not promote the development of pancreatic cancer

Sentences86.text: The large number of AIP patients in whom cancers are detected at or within one year of the AIP diagnosis strongly suggests that AIP and/or IgG4-RD sometimes arise as a paraneoplastic syndrome

Sentences87.text: Confirmation of these findings awaits future-prospective studies in which the incidences of cancer in patients with AIP and/or IgG4-RD are directly compared with those in age- sex- and risk factor-matched control subjects

Sentences0.text: Pemphigus can be divided into three major forms pemphigus vulgaris PV  pemphigus foliaceus PF  and paraneoplastic pemphigus PNP

Sentences1.text: Alike PV PF and PNP IgA pemphigus is an extremely rare variant of pemphigus in which IgA but not IgG autoantibodies against epidermal antigens can be identified 3 7 8

Sentences2.text: Epidemiology of Paraneoplastic Pemphigus PNP is considered a rare disease with about 500 cases reported in the literature 6 23

Sentences3.text: PNP accounts for 3–5 of all pemphigus cases 6 23

Sentences4.text: Furthermore PNP can affect also children and adolescents particularly in association with Castleman s disease 6 23

Sentences5.text: Paraneoplastic Pemphigus PNP is a rare pemphigus variant which is always associated with underlying neoplasms both malignant and benign

Sentences8.text: showed that in patients with NAFLD and insulin resistance FGF19 synthesis is preserved while liver response to FGF19 is impaired 54

Sentences9.text: The negative correlation between FGF19 and obesity has also been confirmed in animal studies

Sentences10.text: Administration of human recombinant FGF19 to mice in which obesity was induced by high-fat diet resulted in a dose-dependent significant decrease in body weight and blood glucose concentration

Sentences11.text: Diabetes Transgenic mice bearing the FGF19 gene show an increased sensitivity to insulin compared to the wild type 59

Sentences12.text: Similarly the administration of exogenous FGF19 prevents the development of glucose metabolism disorders

Sentences13.text: In mice with obesity genetically induced by ablation of brown adipose tissue or lack of leptin FGF19 prevented or reversed diabetes 12

Sentences14.text: Recent studies have demonstrated that FGF19 administered to cerebral ventricles results in insulin-independent decreasing glucose levels in obese mice and increasing insulin sensitivity in mice on a high-fat diet

Sentences15.text: This is consistent with the results obtained in people with diabetes and metabolic syndrome in whom FGF19 concentration negatively correlated with BMI triglycerides HDL cholesterol CRP and glycated hemoglobin levels 5

Sentences16.text: Before the surgery lower concentrations of FGF19 and fatty acids were observed in people with diabetes compared to nondiabetic patients regardless of BMI

Sentences17.text: After the surgery a gradual increase in FGF19 and fatty acids concentrations was observed in all patients however it was greater in people with diabetes 5

Sentences18.text: In the end stage of chronic kidney disease an impaired post-meal FGF19 response was observed which was partially normalized by therapy with antioxidants 34

Sentences19.text: An overdose of FGF21 does not lead to hypoglycemia as with insulin

Sentences20.text: Peroxisome proliferator-activated receptors α PPARα is a transcription factor that controls hepatic FGF21 expression in hunger as well as lipid metabolism and energy homeostasis

Sentences21.text: Fenofibrate a PPARα agonist is a potent inducer of FGF21 expression in hunger both in the mouse liver and in human primary hepatocytes

Sentences22.text: In case of FGF21 deficiency in mice the biological activity of PPARα is reduced

Sentences23.text: It is possible that PPARα mainly with help of FGF21 mediates in adaptation of metabolism during hunger or after a meal including ketogenesis fatty acid oxidation or gluconeogenesis 10 17 37 47 75

Sentences24.text: In mice with diet-induced obesity and missing β-Klotho co-receptor in the central nervous system the beneficial effects of FGF21 on the body weight or insulin resistance were not observed 15 44

Sentences25.text: The administration of FGF21 directly into the cerebrospinal fluid increases energy expenditure and reduces insulin resistance in obese rats 10 70

Sentences26.text: Both transgenic expression and administration of FGF21 induce mice into a lethargic state

Sentences27.text: FGF21 KO mice are more susceptible to cerulein-induced pancreatitis CIP  while FGF21 transgenic mice are resistant to acute pancreatitis

Sentences28.text: Short-term administration of FGF21 reduces insulin levels in both healthy and db/db mice diabetes mice

Sentences29.text: In contrast to the peroxisome proliferator-activated receptor PPARγ agonist and metformin FGF21 leads to a rapid insulin sensitization within 1 h Such fast action may indicate post-translational mechanisms without the need for new protein synthesis

Sentences30.text: Studies have shown that FGF21 levels are positively correlated with obesity and hepatic steatosis degree

Sentences31.text: Reduction of FGF21 level in mice on a ketogenic diet leads to hepatic steatosis lipemia and a decrease of serum ketone concentration 4 75

Sentences32.text: Another study has shown that FGF21 induces adipocyte differentiation and lipogenesis in obese mice

Sentences33.text: Administration of exogenous FGF21 increases the body ability to defend against chronic cold by increasing the expression of UCP1 and other thermogenic genes in adipose tissue

Sentences34.text: Studies on the relationship between WAT and an FGF21 pharmacological action in metabolism regulation concluded that the therapeutic effect of FGF21 on carbohydrate and lipid metabolism disorders is independent of the transformation of white into brown adipose tissue

Sentences35.text: However exogenous FGF21 or mimetic FGF21 induce similar effects such as increased energy expenditure without altering the food intake weight loss and regulation of glucose and lipid levels

Sentences36.text: Diabetes The FGF21 levels increased in type 2 diabetes and is positively correlated with hypertension hyperglycemia glycated hemoglobin level insulin resistance and hsCRP level 10

Sentences37.text: Multiple studies have been done to determine the relationship between FGF21 and type 2 diabetes mellitus 10 53 75

Sentences38.text: A large Chinese prospective study has found that increase of FGF21 levels positively correlated with hyperglycemia and dyslipidemia in pre-diabetic subjects of normal phenotype 8

Sentences39.text: However FGF21 level in the case of type 1 diabetes and latent autoimmune diabetes of adults LADA was significantly lower than in a healthy control group 61 67

Sentences40.text: The diminishing effect on FGF21 level in type 1 and LADA diabetes is probably caused by insulin deficiency which acts as an inducer of hepatic FGF21 53 75

Sentences41.text: A functional study has shown that an administration of exogenous FGF21 to diabetic mice resulted in decreased blood glucose and lipids improved insulin sensitivity weight loss increased fat consumption and energy expenditure 75

Sentences42.text: As FGF21 has been shown to reduce glucose and lipid levels it has been suggested as a potential therapeutic agent for the treatment of diabetes obesity and dyslipidemia 3

Sentences43.text: Administration of the FGF21 analogue to people suffering from obesity and type 2 diabetes caused beneficial effects on some disorders associated with diabetes however further studies with the analogue are needed 3 13

Sentences44.text: Therefore FGF21 is currently considered as a therapeutic option but also as a predictive marker for the development of type 2 diabetes

Sentences45.text: Since reduced FGF19 level is a contributing factor in the development of gestational diabetes it created much interest in understanding the role of FGF21 61 62

Sentences46.text: 58 observed similar blood level of FGF21 in women who are healthy and those suffering from gestational diabetes however it was positively correlated with markers of insulin resistance and dyslipidemia including triglycerides leptin adiponectin and HDL

Sentences47.text: Although studies suggest that reduced FGF19 level may play a role in the pathophysiology of gestational diabetes the increased FGF21 level may be a response to the disease 58 61 62

Sentences48.text: Obesity Obese diabetic mice as well as people suffering from obesity show elevated FGF21 levels 3

Sentences49.text: Mouse studies have shown that high-fat diet-induced obesity leads to FGF21 blood level increase

Sentences50.text: Whereas sensitivity to FGF21 can be restored by weight loss or by a therapeutic glucose level reduction 33 75

Sentences51.text: Interestingly the studies in obese diabetic volunteers demonstrate the FGF21 analog LY2405319 causes body weight loss 15 40

Sentences52.text: It has been observed that FGF21 level increases during hunger and in overfeeding in adults as well as in children

Sentences53.text: Obese children show an elevated blood concentration of free fatty acids that stimulate FGF21 secretion

Sentences54.text: FGF21 may be considered an independent marker of metabolic syndrome and obesity 10 48

Sentences55.text: Vascular diseases FGF21 is also produced and secreted by cardiomyocytes and acts as a cardiomyokine 10

Sentences56.text: Patients with atherosclerotic carotid arteries disease have been shown to have elevated FGF21 levels that are positively correlated to risk factors such as adverse lipid profile and CRP

Sentences57.text: High FGF21 levels predicted the incidence coronary artery disease 32

Sentences58.text: Moreover FGF21 deletion increases myocardial fatty tissue likely via positive regulation of NF-E2 an Nrf2 transcription factor and CD36 which causes increased myocardial oxidative stress and changes in the heart muscle structure and possible development of diabetic cardiomyopathy

Sentences59.text: FGF21 also protects H9C2 cells embryonic rat cardiomyocytes from oxidative stress and apoptosis caused by ischemia-reperfusion injury 71 75

Sentences60.text: Kidney diseases Animal studies have shown that FGF21 prevents diabetic nephropathy by improving metabolic systems and anti-fibrotic effect

Sentences61.text: It has been observed that FGF21 has a beneficial effect on the kidneys of mice with type 1 diabetes because it prevents oxidative stress inflammation apoptosis and fibrosis 73 75

Sentences62.text: In patients with chronic and acute kidney disease FGF21 levels increase as the disease progresses 35 75

Sentences63.text: FGF19 and FGF21 are also considered as predictors of development of some diseases for example type 2 diabetes non-alkoholic fatty liver disease atherosclerosis coronary artery disease and chronic kidney disease
